node.title: OIE Administered Scholarships February 15, 2019 Deadline
node.body:
Students who are interested in applying for the OIE Administered Scholarships are encouraged to go here to complete the online application. Applicants only need to submit one application to be considered for all OIE-Administered Scholarships for which they are eligible. The OIE Administered Scholarships deadline is Friday, February 15, 2019.

Student are encouraged to apply early for scholarships. For instance, students could apply for scholarships to study abroad in fall 2019 and if selected to receive an award, OIE will hold that award until then.

If there are questions or concerns, please email: scholarships@oie.gatech.edu
node.author: Ashlee Flinn

node.title: Exchange Study Abroad Meet and Greet
node.body: Returned Exchange study abroad students and students preparing to study abroad on exchange are invited to come share their experiences with each other and OIE Exchange Advisors. This will be a fun and valuable time to learn about exchanges from students who have been there. There will also be snacks!

node.title: Photo Contest 2018 Reception
node.author: lboydstun3
node.teaser: The Office of International Education will be revealing the winners of our annual photo contest, which showcases the best travel photographs from international and study abroad students at our annual Photo Contest reception.
node.sentence: The Office of International Education will be revealing the winners of our annual photo contest, which showcases the best travel photographs from international and study abroad students at our annual Photo Contest reception.
node.summary: The Office of International Education will be revealing the winners of our annual photo contest, which showcases the best travel photographs from international and study abroad students. We believe in the power of pictures to tell a story and are proud to share these students' intriguing stories, as captured through the lenses of their cameras. We had hundreds of amazing submissions, come see our favorites! Prizes will be given out and light refreshments will be provided.

node.title: How to Afford Study Abroad
node.body:
This session will focus on students interested in funding their study abroad experience with OIE Administered Scholarships, campus study abroad scholarships, national scholarship and fellowship opportunities, and will also discuss other tips for funding international experiences.

For more information, please visit us in Savant building #211 or at: https://oie.gatech.edu/ea/study-abroad-scholarships
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: Come learn tips and tricks to make study abroad more affordable.
node.sentence: Come learn tips and tricks to make study abroad more affordable.
node.summary: Come to this information session to learn about different factors students should consider when choosing a program, GA Tech and National scholarship opportunities, and some advice on non-traditional fundraising options.
node.contact:
Ashlee Flinn
631 Cherry St.
Savant Building #211
Atlanta, GA 30332-0284
404/894-7475

node.title: LGBTQIA Study Abroad Information Session
node.body:
The Office of International Education and the LGBTQIA Resource Center are excited to host this annual workshop to discuss study abroad options and resources. Come enjoy refreshments and get information about your study abroad options from an LGBTQIA perspective on November 6, 2018 from 11am-12pm in Student Center #332. 

For Study Abroad Resources & Scholarships, please visit: https://oie.gatech.edu/ea/lgbtqia-student-resources
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: Please join us for study abroad information, resources, and snacks!
node.sentence: Please join us for study abroad information, resources, and snacks!
node.summary: Are you LGBTQIA-identified and planning to study abroad? Do you have questions about what the process is, where to go, how to find community and resources abroad, what to do about documentation and identification, appearance, scholarships, and more? Then you're invited to this session to learn more!
node.contact:
Ashlee Flinn 
ashlee.flinn@oie.gatech.edu 
404-894-7475
631 Cherry St.
Savant #211
Atlanta, GA 30332-0284
https://oie.gatech.edu/ea/lgbtqia-student-resources

node.title: Unpacking your Global Experience
node.body: Employers increasingly report that they are looking for college graduates with international experience and global savvy. Come to this interactive workshop to learn how to include your study abroad or intern abroad experiences in your resume and cover letters to demonstrate to potential employers that you are ready to work in a global economy. Please bring a copy of your resume with you.
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: This session will help students who have returned from an international experience (global internship or study abroad) think about how to convey the importance of this experience to future employers.
node.sentence: This session will help students who have returned from an international experience (global internship or study abroad) think about how to convey the importance of this experience to future employers.
node.summary: Employers increasingly report that they are looking for college graduates with international experience and global savvy. Come to this interactive workshop to learn how to include your study abroad or intern abroad experiences in your resume and cover letters to demonstrate to potential employers that you are ready to work in a global economy. Please bring a copy of your resume with you.

node.title: Study Abroad 101: Featuring the International Plan
node.body:
Georgia Tech’s 130+ Study Abroad opportunities span every continent and academic discipline. Study abroad is open to all undergraduate majors with the opportunity to study abroad for fall, spring, summer, or for the full academic year. This session will focus on students interested in completing the award-winning International Plan. The International Plan is Georgia Tech's globally-focused degree designation, recognizing students who have committed to making global competence a core part of their GT experience.

We know that there is much to consider when planning to study abroad and these Study Abroad 101 sessions are intended to give students general information about study abroad to help them get started. 

For more information, please visit us in Savant building #211 or at: http://oie.gatech.edu/study-abroad
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: These sessions are intended to give students general study abroad information to help them get started in selecting a study abroad program. This session will also focus on students interested in completing the International Plan during their time at Tech.
node.sentence: These sessions are intended to give students general study abroad information to help them get started in selecting a study abroad program. This session will also focus on students interested in completing the International Plan during their time at Tech.
node.summary: These sessions are intended to give students general study abroad information to help them get started in selecting a study abroad program. This session will also focus on students interested in completing the International Plan during their time at Tech.

URL: https://oie.gatech.edu/ip_welcome

node.body:
Students who are interested in applying for the OIE Administered Scholarships are encouraged to go here to complete the online application. Applicants only need to submit one application to be considered for all OIE-Administered Scholarships for which they are eligible. The OIE Administered Scholarships deadline is Monday, October 15, 2018.

Student are encouraged to apply early for scholarships. For instance, students could apply for scholarships to study abroad in summer 2019 and if selected to receive an award, OIE will hold that award until then.

If there are questions or concerns, please email: scholarships@oie.gatech.edu

node.title: Study Abroad Fair 2018
node.body:
Georgia Tech's Office of International Education will be hosting the annual Study Abroad Fair on October 2, 2018 from 10am-2pm in the Student Center Ballroom to help the campus community learn about international opportunities!

Tech has 85 partner universities in over 30 countries around the world and also leads over 35 faculty-led programs abroad each year. The Fair is your chance to:

  • Meet Program Directors, Faculty, and Study Abroad Advisors
  • Talk to recently returned students and international students from our partner universities
  • Learn about financial aid and study abroad scholarships
  • Learn about other international opportunities, like interning abroad!

All undergraduate majors can earn major and elective credit while studying on a Tech study abroad program--so, come learn more about these opportunities!  Start doing your research for the fair here: https://oie.gatech.edu/study-abroad-programs.

For more information, please visit: https://oie.gatech.edu/sa/home
node.author: lboydstun3
node.teaser: Study Abroad Fair 2018
node.sentence: Study Abroad Fair 2018
node.summary:
Georgia Tech's Office of International Education will be hosting the annual Study Abroad Fair on October 2, 2018 from 10am-2pm in the Student Center Ballroom to help the campus community learn about international opportunities!  We'll have free food and prizes available!

Tech has 85 partner universities in over 30 countries around the world and also leads over 35 faculty-led programs abroad each year. The Fair is your chance to:

  • Meet Program Directors, Faculty, and Study Abroad Advisors
  • Talk to recently returned students and international students from our partner universities
  • Learn about financial aid and study abroad scholarships
  • Learn about other international opportunities, like interning abroad!

All undergraduate majors can earn major and elective credit while studying on a Tech study abroad program--so, come learn more about these opportunities!  Start doing your research for the fair here: https://oie.gatech.edu/study-abroad-programs.

For more information, please visit: https://oie.gatech.edu/sa/home

node.title: Gilman Scholarship Deadline: October 2, 2018
node.body:
The Gilman International Scholarship Program is a program of the U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs (ECA) and offers grants of up to $5,000 to U.S. undergraduate students of high financial need participating in credit-bearing study abroad programs or international internships.  Students studying a critical need language could be eligible to receive a grant of up to $8,000. The Gilman Program aims to diversify the kinds of students who study and intern abroad and the countries and regions where they go by supporting U.S. undergraduates who might otherwise not consider these unique and valuable opportunities due to financial constraints.  

For more information, please visit www.gilmanscholarship.org for more details.
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: The Gilman International Scholarship application deadline is: October 2, 2018 @ 11:59pm (CDT) for Spring 2019 & Early Summer 2019 applicants.
node.sentence: The Gilman International Scholarship application deadline is: October 2, 2018 @ 11:59pm (CDT) for Spring 2019 & Early Summer 2019 applicants.
node.summary: The Gilman International Scholarship application deadline is: October 2, 2018 @ 11:59pm (CDT) for Spring 2019 & Summer 2019 applicants.

node.body:
Georgia Tech’s 130+ Study Abroad opportunities span every continent and academic discipline. Study abroad is open to all undergraduate majors with the opportunity to study abroad for fall, spring, summer, or for the full academic year. This session will focus on students interested in studying abroad on one of Tech's 35 Faculty Led Study Abroad Programs. Just like all of Tech's study abroad options, students earn academic credit towards their degree while on these programs.

For more information, please visit us in Savant building #211 or at: http://oie.gatech.edu/study-abroad

node.title: Gilman Scholarship Workshop
node.body:
The Gilman International Scholarship aims to diversify the kinds of students who study abroad and the countries and regions where they go by offering awards to U.S. undergrads who might otherwise not participate due to financial constraints.

OIE will be hosting a Gilman Workshop to give information about the program and tips on how to craft a competitive application on Thursday, Sept. 20 from 11am-12pm in Student Center #301. We hope to see you there!

node.title: Study Abroad Deadline: Exchanges
node.body: Students who are interested in studying abroad on many Exchanges during the 2019 spring should make sure to submit their application materials on-time. While deadlines may vary for programs, September 1, 2018 is the deadline for many Tech Exchanges. For full details and information, please visit our website: http://oie.gatech.edu/study-abroad-programs.

node.title: International Night at Tech Rec
node.body: International Night at Tech Rec is an event sponsored by OIE and Georgia Tech International Ambassadors. This fun night is full of coffee, tea, food, and lots of interesting conversation and fun activities. OIE has rented out the entire Tech Rec! Bowling, billiards, video games and air hockey will be free to all students in attendance.  This event are a great way for new students to meet friends from both the U.S and returning from abroad! All students are welcome.
node.author: cjohnson401
node.teaser: International Night at Tech Rec is an event sponsored by OIE and Georgia Tech International Ambassadors. This fun night is full of coffee, tea, food, and lots of interesting conversation and fun activities.

node.title: Study Abroad 101: Exchange Edition
node.body:
With over 130 different programs, Georgia Tech Study Abroad opportunities span every continent and academic discipline. Study abroad is open to all undergraduate students with the opportunity to study abroad for fall, spring, summer, or for the full academic year. This session will focus on students interested in doing an exchange at a partner university. Just like all of Tech's study abroad options, students earn academic credit towards their degree while on an exchange program. If a student plans ahead, study abroad shouldn't delay graduation. Please note that the Spring 2019 Exchange Deadline is September 1, 2018--so, students should act fast!

For more information, please visit us in Savant building #211 or at: http://atlas.gatech.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=Programs.SimpleSearch

node.title: School of History and Sociology Fall 2018 Speakers Series- Sven Beckert
node.author: lwondwossen3
node.teaser: The School of History and Sociology welcomes Dr. Sven Beckert, Laird Bell Professor of History at Harvard University.
node.sentence: The School of History and Sociology welcomes Dr. Sven Beckert, Laird Bell Professor of History at Harvard University.
node.summary: The School of History and Sociology welcomes Dr. Sven Beckert, Laird Bell Professor of History at Harvard University. Dr. Beckert will give a talk on "Empire of Cotton: The Global Origins of Modern Capitalism." The talk is from 4:00 - 5:30 in the Student Success Center, President's Suite C&D.  All are welcome.
node.location: Student Success Center, President's Suite C&D

node.title: How to Succeed as an F-1 Student (for Fall 2018 Admitted Students)
node.body: Success at GA Tech is more than getting straight As.  In order to succeed while studying in the U.S, F-1 students need to comply with numerous immigration regulations. Violation of these regulations could greatly impact a student’s ability to succeed academically.  All newly admitted F-1 students are required to attend this session.  Students in attendance will learn about enrollment requirements, travel issues, working in the U.S (on and off-campus) and other relevant F-1 topics.  For attendance purposes, students will be asked to present their GT identification card (Buzzcard) at the session.
node.author: cjohnson401

Violation of these regulations could greatly impact a student’s ability to succeed academically.  All newly admitted F-1 students are required to attend this session.  Students in attendance will learn about enrollment requirements, travel issues, working in the U.S (on and off-campus) and other relevant F-1 topics.  For attendance purposes, students will be asked to present their GT identification card (Buzzcard) at the session.

node.title: How to Succeed as a J-1 Student (for Fall 2018 Admitted Students)
node.body: Success at GA Tech is more than getting straight As.  In order to succeed while studying in the U.S, J-1 students need to comply with numerous immigration regulations. Violation of these regulations could greatly impact a student’s ability to succeed academically. All newly admitted J-1 students are required to attend this session.  Students in attendance will learn about enrollment requirements, travel issues, working in the U.S. and other relevant J-1 topics.  For attendance purposes, students will be asked to present their GT identification card (Buzzcard) at the session.

node.title: International Opportunities Open House
node.body:
Please come meet OIE advisors and learn about study abroad opportunities, Global Internships, the International Plan, scholarships, and more. This is a great time to ask questions about Tech's many programs in one place and indulge in some free Chick-Fil-A chicken nuggets.

We hope to see you there!
node.author: Ashlee Flinn
node.teaser: Please join OIE advisors for information about the many ways you can take your academic career global.
node.sentence: Please join OIE advisors for information about the many ways you can take your academic career global.
node.summary:
You're invited to come meet OIE advisors and learn about study abroad opportunities, Global Internships, the International Plan, scholarships, and more. This is a great time to ask questions about Tech's many programs and get some free Chick-Fil-A chicken nuggets.

 We hope to see you there!
node.location: Student Center Peachtree Room on the Georgia Tech Campus

item.body:
Please come meet OIE advisors and learn about study abroad opportunities, Global Internships, the International Plan, scholarships, and more. This is a great time to ask questions about Tech's many programs in one place and indulge in some free Chick-Fil-A chicken nuggets.

We hope to see you there!
